definition: surname Kang/Kang, one of the 28 constellations

sentences.english: Zhaoxia have the face of dawn, excited the passion of life.
sentences.chinese: 曾經面對朝霞晨曦，亢奮着生命的激情。

sentences.english: When we want to feel energized, we think about caffeine.
sentences.chinese: 當我們想感覺亢奮時，會想到咖啡因。

sentences.english: But you have that caffeine making you more alert, so you keep drinking.
sentences.chinese: 但那些咖啡因會讓你更亢奮，所以你會接着喝。

sentences.english: She says she loves the hyped-up adrenaline feeling of trying to beat an opponent.
sentences.chinese: 她說自己比賽時特別亢奮，一心想着打敗對手。

sentences.english: This is not like vicodin — take too much and you get a little high.
sentences.chinese: 這可不像維柯丁，多用一些能更加亢奮。

sentences.english: It was a time of great and exalting excitement.
sentences.chinese: 這是極度亢奮刺激的時代。

sentences.english: I can comfort myself with exhilaration that I have a share in its being yellow.
sentences.chinese: 亢奮地安慰自己，你的黃，有我一份。

sentences.english: I was so hyper-aware of my body that I may have been making myself sick and tired.
sentences.chinese: 意識到我的身體已經噁心疲憊了，我就如此的亢奮。

sentences.english: Drug users may also hire escorts to accompany them while they get high.
sentences.chinese: 吸毒的人或許還會在亢奮後租用陪護人員來看護他們。

sentences.english: I am incredibly tetchy and snappy; more than usual?
sentences.chinese: 我難以置信的易怒和亢奮，如此不同尋常？

definition: to undulate/to fluctuate/wave motion/rise and fall
attitude (of the heart)/state of one's psyche/way of thinking/mentality
to be fired up (idiom)/to have one's blood racing
